baseline: Even after the fall of Qin in 206 BCE, an emperor's words were considered sacred edicts (聖旨) and his written proclamations "directives from above" (上諭).

prompts: Theocracy is a form of government in which one or more deities are recognized as supreme ruling
baseline: Theocracy is a form of government in which one or more deities are recognized as supreme ruling authorities, giving divine guidance to human intermediaries who manage the government's daily affairs.

prompts: The word theocracy originates from the Greek : θεοκρατία ( theocratia ) meaning " the rule
baseline: The word theocracy originates from the Greek: θεοκρατία (theocratia) meaning "the rule of God".

prompts: Josephus offered the term theocracy to describe this polity in
baseline: Josephus offered the term theocracy to describe this polity in which a god was sovereign and the god's word was law.

prompts: The term theocracy derives from the Koine Greek θεοκρατία , " rule of God " , a term used by Josephus for
baseline: The term theocracy derives from the Koine Greek θεοκρατία, "rule of God", a term used by Josephus for the kingdoms of Israel and Judah, reflecting the view that "God himself is recognized as the head" of the state.

prompts: According to Merriam - Webster 's Dictionary , there are two meanings for
baseline: According to Merriam-Webster's Dictionary, there are two meanings for the word theocracy: (1) government of a state by immediate divine guidance or by officials who are regarded as divinely guided; and (2) a state governed by a theocracy.

prompts: Afghanistan was an Islamic theocracy when the Taliban first ruled Afghanistan from 1996
baseline: Afghanistan was an Islamic theocracy when the Taliban first ruled Afghanistan from 1996 to 2001 and since their reinstatement of the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan in 2021, Afghanistan is an Islamic theocracy again.

prompts: However , some critiques describe Saudi Arabia as
baseline: However, some critiques describe Saudi Arabia as an Islamic theocracy.

baseline: Since few theocracies exist in the modern world, the word "theocracy" is now used as a descriptive term for a government which enforces a state religion.

prompts: The Shang dynasty ( c.   1600 BCE to c.   1045 BCE ) essentially functioned as a theocracy
baseline: The Shang dynasty (c. 1600 BCE to c. 1045 BCE) essentially functioned as a theocracy, declaring the ruling family the sons of heaven and calling the chief sky god Shangdi after a word for their deceased ancestors.

prompts: The Heavenly Kingdom of Great Peace ( 1851 to 1864 ) in Qing China was a heterodox Christian
baseline: The Heavenly Kingdom of Great Peace (1851 to 1864) in Qing China was a heterodox Christian theocracy led by Hong Xiuquan, who portrayed himself as the younger brother of Jesus Christ.

prompts: Jennifer Fretland VanVoorst argues that " the Byzantine Empire became a theocracy in
baseline: Jennifer Fretland VanVoorst argues that "the Byzantine Empire became a theocracy in the sense that Christian values and ideals were the foundation of the empire's political ideals and heavily entwined with its political goals".

prompts: Steven Runciman writes in his book
baseline: Steven Runciman writes in his book The Byzantine Theocracy (2004):

prompts: Historians debate the extent to
baseline: Historians debate the extent to which Geneva, Switzerland, in the days of John Calvin (1509–64) was a theocracy.

prompts: In nearby Zürich , Switzerland , Protestant reformer Huldrych Zwingli ( 1484–1531 ) built a political system
baseline: In nearby Zürich, Switzerland, Protestant reformer Huldrych Zwingli (1484–1531) built a political system that many scholars have called a theocracy, while others have denied it.

prompts: The question of theocracy has been debated extensively by historians
baseline: The question of theocracy has been debated extensively by historians regarding the  Latter-Day Saint communities in Illinois and (especially) in Utah.

prompts: This original organization , based upon Joseph Smith 's   concept of theodemocracy , instituted a governmental system
baseline: This original organization, based upon Joseph Smith's  concept of theodemocracy, instituted a governmental system combining biblical theocracy with mid-19th-century American political ideals.

prompts: The short rule ( 1494–1498 ) of Girolamo Savonarola , a   Dominican priest , over the city of Florence had features of a
baseline: The short rule (1494–1498) of Girolamo Savonarola, a  Dominican priest, over the city of Florence had features of a theocracy.

prompts: Quebec under the premiership of Maurice Duplessis ( 1936 - 1939 and 1944 - 1959 ) had attributes of a
baseline: Quebec under the premiership of Maurice Duplessis (1936-1939 and 1944-1959) had attributes of a Roman Catholic theocracy.

prompts: This theocracy ended in 1960 with
baseline: This theocracy ended in 1960 with the beginning of the Quiet Revolution (1960-1966).

prompts: It emerged from the Eparchy of Cetinje , later known as the Metropolitanate
baseline: It emerged from the Eparchy of Cetinje, later known as the Metropolitanate of Montenegro and the Littoral, whose bishops defied the Ottoman Empire overlordship and transformed the parish of Cetinje into a de facto theocracy, ruling it as Metropolitans (Vladike, also known as prince-bishops).

prompts: Theocracy is a form of government in which God or a deity is recognized as the supreme
baseline: Theocracy is a form of government in which God or a deity is recognized as the supreme civil ruler.

Smith wrote in 1842 that earthly governments "have failed in all their attempts to promote eternal peace and happiness....  is rent, from center to circumference, with party strife, political intrigues, and sectional interest."

prompts: In 1859 , Church President Brigham Young equated the terms "
baseline: In 1859, Church President Brigham Young equated the terms "republican theocracy" and "democratic theocracy" and expressed his understanding of them when he taught, "The kingdom that the Almighty will set up in the latter days will have its officers, and those officers will be peace.

baseline: However, later critics labeled the town a "theocracy," mostly because of the position of many church leaders, including Smith, as elected city officials.

baseline: Some critics  see theonomy as a significant form of dominion theology, which they define as a type of theocracy.
